info.name: Sarpanch API
info.description:
This is the API for the Sarpanch App. It is composed of 2 major sections:

1. Authentication
    * This is built on an phone OTP based verification system for sign up and an username and password based login section. 

2. Content Mangement
    * Content Posts for various schemes, stored in HTML with Rich Text Formatting.

item.name: Validate Phone Number and Send OTP

request.description: This allows users to request an OTP and create an account. Then the verification is done through the admin panel to activate the user's account.

response.name: Validate Phone Number and Send OTP
Validate Phone Number and Send OTP - Success

request.description: After the user gets the OTP, this view verifies that the OTP they enter is the correct one.

response.name: Validate OTP - Not sent to entered phone number
Validate OTP - Success
Validate OTP - Bad Input Data
Validate OTP - Incorrect
Validate OTP - Success

request.description: This is the register endpoint. The phone number passed here must have already validated the OTP it got. You must also pass a password here. Verification of matching passwords should be taken care of on the frontend, however, the API will validate the password strength according to a series of parameters and will return an appropriate response to show to the user.

response.name: Register - OTP not validated
Register - Bad Password
Register - OTP not requested
Register - Success
Register - Bad Data
Register - Additional Field

response.name: Login - Wrong Password

request.description: Deletes the Knox token assinged to the current user
A logged in user can change thier password.

response.name: Change Password - Wrong Password
Change Password - Success
Change Password - Bad New Password

item.name: Validate Phone Number and Send OTP for Forgot Password

request.description: If a user forget's their password this request validates thier phone number and sends them and OTP which they can verify to change their password.

response.name: Validate Phone Number and Send OTP for Forgot Password - Success

request.description: Send the phone and OTP after requesting a forgotten password otp here.

response.name: Validate Forgotten Password OTP - Success
Change Forgotten Password - Success

item.name: Content Management

request.description:
This request returns the list of all the recipes. 

# Use with caution
The payload size of this request is very large, hence it is *strongly* reccomended that you use the ?limit=n query parameter to get certain recipes at a time. 

## How to use the pagination query parameters? 
The two pagination query params are ?limit and ?offset. 
They are best described: 
    The client includes both a "limit" and an "offset" query parameter. The limit indicates the maximum number of items to return, and is equivalent to the page_size in other styles. The offset indicates the starting position of the query in relation to the complete set of unpaginated items.

## How to use the filtering query params? 
The following are the names of the q params that you can use to filter the data. Use these in conjunction with the pagniation tools so obtain a filtered, paginated queryset. 

* ?title_contains= (if the title contains this param)
* ?category= (equality filter)
* ?region= (equality filter)
* ?created_before= (less than filter)
* ?updated_before= (less than filter)
etc. 


**Note:** time based filters must be entered in the following time format
Supports both Django (‘%d %H:%M:%S.%f’) and ISO 8601 formatted durations (but only the sections that are accepted by Python’s timedelta, so no year, month, and week designators, e.g. ‘P3DT10H22M’).

### Search 
This returns all recipes given a general search string. Use the `?search=` query parameter.

response.name: Posts List - With Pagination
response.body:
[ { "title": "Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)", "sub_title": "Post Sub Title", "slug": "pradhan-mantri-kisan-samman-nidhi-pm-kisan-2021-01-15-18-14-40", "thumbnail": "https://sarpanch-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/media/public/thumbnails/Square_200x200.png", "content": "

Ministry of Finance initiative meant to increase financial inclusion by making it easier to access financial services.

 

How can you benefit from PMJDY?

  • Gives you the opportunity to become financially independent and capable.
    • This makes it easier to get loans, safely save your money in a bank account, and more.
    • If you care about your money, it is important that you keep it safe through such financial mechanisms.

 

Description:

  • PMJDY ensures Indian citizens with access to financial Banking Services, Deposit Accounts, Remittances, Credit, Insurance, and Pension in an affordable and easily accessible way.

 

Best features of PMJDY:

  • PMJDY makes the complex process of becoming financially responsible much easier by providing guidance and assistance.

 

Instructions:

 

This initiative is intended for all Indian citizens, including minors 10 years or older who can start accounts with a guardian.

 

  1. Open a Basic Savings Bank Account (BSBD) by going to your nearest Savings Bank of India branch (SBI).
  2. Once you have a BSBD account, select the financial services you would like to access.
", "created_on": "2021-01-15T23:44:40.631661+05:30", "updated_on": "2021-01-17T02:59:49.240382+05:30" }, { "title": "Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojna (PMMY)", "sub_title": "Ministry of Finance initiative that allows one to take out loans without paying processing fees or providing collateral for use in small-sized non-farm enterprises.", "slug": "pradhan-mantri-mudra-yojna-pmmy-2021-01-16-21-44-04", "thumbnail": "https://sarpanch-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/media/public/thumbnails/Square_200x200_vxqv0FD.png", "content": "

Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojna (PMMY)

Ministry of Finance initiative that allows one to take out loans without paying processing fees or providing collateral for use in small-sized non-farm enterprises. 

 

How can you benefit from PMMY?

  • Provides Financial Assistance to help you achieve your business goals.
    • Provides a range of loans to help with whatever type and size of venture you are working on.
    • Doesn’t require collateral or payment of processing fees - minimizes risks.

 

Description:

  • There is no minimum loan size under the PMMY scheme, but the maximum loan size that can be taken out under the is of Rs.10 Lakh. 
  • Borrowers don’t need to pay any processing fees or provide any form of collateral. 
  • Mudra loans can be offered to enterprises in the non-farm sector and in allied agricultural activities.
  • 3 Types of Mudra Loans:
    • Shishu: Loans sanctioned under the PMMY scheme up to Rs.50000
    • Kishore: Loans sanctioned under the PMMY scheme from Rs.50001 up to Rs.5.00 lakh
    • Tarun: Loans sanctioned under the PMMY scheme Rs.5,00,001 up to Rs.10.00 lakh

 

Best Features of PMMY:

  • No collateral or processing fees need to be provided
    • Makes it cheaper and safer for you to apply for these loans.
  • PMMY loans can be applied to a range of activities in a range of sectors, giving you the option to apply no matter the field your activity falls under.

 

Instructions:

 

To get a PMMY loan, you must fulfill this criteria:

  • A non-farm enterprises
  • A Micro and Small Enterprises
  • Engaged in income generating activities
  • Engaged in “income-generating activities” and “manufacturing, trading services”
  • Have credit needs up to Rs.10 Lakh

 

These loans are available at Commercial Banks, Regional Rural Banks (RRBs), Small-Finance Banks, Microfinance Institutions (MFIs), and Nonbank Financial Companies (NBFCs).

 

For Physical Enrollment:

  • The borrower can approach any of the above-mentioned institutions.
  • Go to https://mudra.org.in/Home/PMMYBankersKit
    • Download the form for the type of loan you would like.

  • Before approaching, ensure that you fulfill all requirements on the checklist.

 


 

THE CLOSEST ONE TO YOU LOCATOR

 

For Online Enrollment:

  1. The borrower can apply online via the portal at www.udyamimitra.in
  2. Press on the APPLY NOW button in the Mudra Loans section.

  1. Scroll down to the Apply for MUDRA Loan and click the 

  1. If you are not Sidbi/UdyamiMitra Member yet, 
    1. You will need to create an account. Put your name, email address, and phone number
    2. You should shortly receive an email or a text message with your OTP code.
    3. From there you should be allowed to create your account.

 

 

", "created_on": "2021-01-17T03:14:03.937623+05:30", "updated_on": "2021-01-17T03:15:32.569426+05:30" } ]

request.description: This gets a single recipe by passing the id or primary key to the URL.
Returns a list of the active categories.

response.name: Category List

item.description: This section includes all the requests to query and retrive posts about various schemes etc.
